WRITEABLE_CONFIG.title: Config cannot be manipulated via the web app
WRITEABLE_CONFIG.description: Changes to the configuration made via the web app will NOT be persisted back into the config.xml. The requests will fail with an error message highlighting this situation.

welcome.title: Welcome to HiveMQ Edge
welcome.description: Connect to and from any device for seamless data streaming to your enterprise infrastructure.

protocolAdapter.title: Use modular HiveMQ Edge protocol adapters to connect to local devices that use different communication protocols.

connectEnterprise.header: From HiveMQ Edge to the Enterprise

bridge.title: Connect your HiveMQ Edge MQTT broker to your enterprise infrastructure with MQTT bridge connections.

section.title: Create a single source of truth for all your enterprise-wide data by seamlessly connecting your HiveMQ Edge deployment to a HiveMQ Cloud MQTT broker.
section.label: Connect To HiveMQ Cloud

bridge.title: MQTT bridges
bridge.description: MQTT bridges let you connect multiple MQTT brokers to enable seamless data sharing between different networks or systems.

error.loading: We cannot load your bridges for the time being. Please try again later

local.info: Subscriptions to your local MQTT Broker are used to forward messages from this HiveMQ Edge to a remote MQTT broker.

remote.info: Subscriptions to a remote MQTT Broker are used to receive messages from a remote MQTT broker on this HiveMQ Edge.

filters.label: Filters
filters.helper: The list of topics used to filter the messages. MQTT wildcards are supported.

error.required: At least one topic is required

destination.label: Destination
destination.helper: The destination topic. You can use '{#}' to keep the original topic.

error.required: At least one topic is required

queueLimit.label: Message Queue Limit
queueLimit.helper: The maximum number of messages persisted for QoS-1 and QoS-2.

topic.placeholder: Type your topic and press enter...

id.label: Name
id.helper: The unique name of this bridge

error.required: The name of the bridge is required
error.pattern: Should only contain alphanumeric characters with spaces and hyphens
error.notUnique: The name is already in use for another bridge

cleanStart.label: Clean Start
cleanStart.helper: Clean start determines if existing MQTT session state should be cleared up on connect.

loopPrevention.label: Enable loop prevention
loopPrevention.helper: Ensure messages cannot cause infinite loops.

hopCount.label: Maximum hop count for bridged messages
hopCount.helper: The maximum number of hops before a message is discarded.

keepAlive.label: Keep Alive
keepAlive.helper: Maximum time (in seconds) that the client maybe considered idle before disconnection

sessionExpiry.label: Session Expiry
sessionExpiry.helper: Time in seconds your session is maintained on the broker

clientid.label: Client Id Override
clientid.helper: Override the client identifier used to connect to the remote broker. Leave empty to use the bridge id.

cipherSuites.label: Cipher Suites
cipherSuites.helper: Select the cipher suites. Leave empty to use the default cipher suites.

enabled.label: Enable Transport Layer Security (TLS)
enabled.helper: If a TLS listener is enabled in HiveMQ, each client connection for that listener is encrypted and secured by TLS

protocols.label: TLS Protocols
protocols.helper: Select the protocols. Leave empty to use the default protocols.

persistence.restartWarning: Change will only be applied after a persisted restart of HIveMQ Edge.

persist.label: MQTT Persistence
persist.helper: Select to store MQTT Traffic greater than QoS 0 on disk.

websocket.description: Websocket configuration associated with the bridge

serverPath.label: Server Path
serverPath.helper: The server path used by the bridge client. This must be setup as path at the remote broker.

subProtocol.label: Sub-protocol
subProtocol.helper: The sub-protocol used by the bridge client. This must be supported by the remote broker

noDataWarning.title: No bridges currently installed
noDataWarning.description: Configure Bridges to start sending data to your enterprise MQTT broker.

stepper.description: Create a new bridge to a broker

protocolAdapter.title: Protocol Adapters
protocolAdapter.description: Protocol adapters allow you to connect your HiveMQ Edge installation to local and remote devices that use communication protocols other than MQTT. Once a connection is established, you can seamlessly consolidate all device data into your HiveMQ Edge MQTT broker.

overview.author: Author:
overview.installation: This adapter needs to be installed separately. Check the instructions

articles.title: Articles

unifiedNamespace.title: Unified Namespace Prefix
unifiedNamespace.description: Setting up a Unified Namespace (UNS) for MQTT data helps you create a centralized, standardized framework for organizing and accessing data across your entire organization.

error.loading: We cannot load your namespace for the time being. Please try again later

info.title: ISA-95 Unified Namespace
descriptions: A Unified Namespace is a centralized framework that allows you to integrate and harmonize data from diverse industrial systems to achieve seamless real-time data exchange and interoperability.
ISA-95 is an international standard that defines a structured way to exchange data within a manufacturing enterprise.
info.link: Learn more about UNS and smart manufacturing on the HiveMQ website

enabled.label: Enable Unified Namespace
enabled.helper: When enabled, the Unified Namespace  tokens can be used in topics to apply the UNS convention to your data.

enterprise.label: Enterprise
enterprise.helper: An enterprise is a top-level hierarchical structure that provides a consolidated view and context for all underlying systems, sites, and processes of an organization.

site.label: Site
site.helper: Sites are physical, geographical, or logical groups within an enterprise.

area.label: Area
area.helper: Areas are physical, geographical, or logical groups within a site

productionLine.label: Production Line
productionLine.helper: Production lines group related work cells and operations into a single logical unit within the manufacturing or operational process.

workCell.label: Work Cell
workCell.helper: Work cells are low-level functional units within a manufacturing or operational process that perform a designated task or series of tasks.

prefixAllTopics.label: Add UNS prefix to all MQTT topics
prefixAllTopics.helper: MQTT topics will use the defined namespace

disabled.description: A unified namespace is no longer setup. All namespaces created remain the same but the standard will no longer be in use in this system.

cluster.title: About Workspace Clustering
help: This interactive graph simulates how the workspace can be automatically organised according to a list of dynamic properties
Use the configuration to define partition keys

configuration.title: Grouping rules
configuration.description: Group adapters, bridges and devices using a combination of the following rules

conceptWheel.title: About the Concept Wheel
help: This interactive graph shows all the concepts being manipulated by this Edge instance.
Topics (and topic filters) and tags are distributed on a expanding circular tree, showing co-location and namespacing.
Note that visualisation is only effective if you are using segments for your naming convention.
Select segment from the wheel to access meta-information about the concept, especially their schema.
